author: holiman
content:
> The alternative is to ask for manual input of every password for every keystore when the validator client starts up

The clef alternative is to enable scripting instead of 'unlock'. So in place of an actual user, a script can take the seat. It can inspect the signing-request, and approve/deny. If approved (either by a human or a script), then clef checks if it already has the password in it's encrypted db. If it doesn't it asks the UI/human for pw
